docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome! 👋 This document will guide you through the use of three functions/features on the web browser version of Slack. Slack is a communication platform used by many businesses and organizations, it is most commonly used to exchange messages and files. Additionally, Slack also supports voice and video calls. The purpose of this document is to provide a detailed step by step guide to adding pronunciation to your profile page, attaching files to a direct message(DM), and marking messages as unread and setting a reminder.

docs.title: Intended users
docs.text:
This user guide is targeted towards:

  • Users who have not used Slack.
  • Users who are familiar with basic features of a computer.
  • Students who intend to use Slack for school.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
This guide assumes the following:

  • Users know how to use File Explorere in Microsoft Windows.
  • Users know how to read and perform keyboard shortcuts.
  • Users have a Slack account.
  • Users are in a Slack workspace.
  • Users are comfortable with using Google Chrome

docs.title: Technology requirements
docs.text:
• Users are on Microsoft Windows 10 or later.
  • Users are on Google Chrome.
  • Users have access to a microphone.
  • Users have access to the web browser version of Slack.

docs.title: Typographical Conventions
docs.text:
1. Button labels are all bold.

example: click on the New Message button.

  1. Any label names that may be different for you will be italicized(usernames, channel names).

example: Click on your username.

  1. Keyboard shortcuts will be styled in green font colour.

example: You can use the keyboard shorcut Ctrl + Z to undo.

  1. Throughout this documentation, coloured blocks are used as admonitions. These colours are ordered here by importance and have the following meanings:

Warning

Specifies content that must be read before proceding.

Success

docs.title: How to Add Your Name's Pronunciation to Your Profile
docs.text:
Slack provides a quick and easy way to inform others on how to pronounce your name. Accommodate others and provide a guide to pronouncing your name by using this feature.

In this section you will provide a text and audio guide to pronouncing your name inside your profile.

docs.title: Steps to Access Your Profile and Add Your Name Pronunciation
docs.text:
1. Click your profile picture labeled with your username on the bottom left.
The Profile icon highlighted with a red square

Success

If steps have been followed correctly, then a popup menu will appear

  1. Click on the Profile button on the popup menu.
The Profile button highlighted with a red square

Success

If steps have been followed correctly, then a right side panel labeled "Profile" should be visible

  1. Click on the Edit button in the Profile page.
The Edit button highlighted with a red square

Success

If steps have been followed correctly, then a popup menu will appear

Note

You can also click the +Add name pronounciation to quickly add a text based pronunciation guide

  1. Add text to textbox labeled name pronunciation.
The name pronunciation textbox highlighted with a red square
  1. Click on Record Audio Clip button.
The Record Audio Clip button highlighted with a red square

Note

If slack already has permission to use your microphone then you can skip step 6

Warning

you must allow slack to use your microphone to complete this task. If you select Never Allow, Block, or the X that will close the popup, please navigate to the Troubleshooting Page.

  1. Click on Allow.
The Allow button in the popup highlighted with a red square

Note

your popup dialog buttons may be labeled differently depending on your version of Google Chrome. Avoid clicking on the one that is most similar to a denial

  1. Say your name into your microphone.

Success

If steps have been followed correctly, then wavefroms will appear where the Record Audio Clip button was previously

  1. Click on the blue play button to listen to your recording.
The play button highlighted with a red square

Note

if you are unsatitsfied with your recording, click the Remove audio clip button to delete the recording and repeat steps 5 and 7 The remove audio clip button highlighted with a red square

  1. Click on the Save Changes button.
The save changes button highlighted with a red square

Success

if all steps have been followed, there will be play name pronunciation button to the right of your username and the text guide under. The play name pronunciation button and text guide highlighted with red squares

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have successfully completed and learnt how to:

  • Add a text guide to pronounce your name to you profile.
  • Add a audio guide to pronounce your name to your profile.

Congratulations! 🎉 Your colleagues can now learn how to pronounce your name. Click the link below to learn how to send a file through a DM:

Send a File using DM

docs.title: How to Mark a Message as Unread and Set a Reminder for it
docs.text:
You will not always have the time to read all the details of a message and after viewing a message you lose the notification regarding said message. This can be annoying as we do not want to lose the reminder to check the message, but also need to check if the message is urgent. Slack has tools to help keep the reminder after viewing the message.

In this section you will reset the unread marker and set a reminder for a message.

docs.title: Steps to Mark a message Unread and set a Reminder
docs.text:
1. Navigate to message you want to mark as unread.

  2. Hover over the message with your mouse.

Success

if steps have been followed correctly, then a popup menu should be visible The message popup menu highlighted with a red square

  1. Click on the three vertical dots button labeled more actions.
The more actions button highlighted with a red square
  1. Click on "Mark unread" option on popup menu.
The Mark unread option highlighted with a red square

Note

you can also use the keyboard shortcut U

Note

at this point you have succesfully marked the message as unread. Then following steps detail setting a reminder for the message

  1. Repeat step 2 and 3

  2. Click on the Remind me about this button.

The Remind me about this button highlighted with a red square
  1. Select a preset time interval or custom time from the popup menu.
The preset time interval or custom time from the popup menu highlighted with a red square

Note

if you selected a preset time interval then you have complted setting a reminder, the next steps detail setting a custom time

  1. Select a date for reminder.
The date drop down menu highlighted with a red square
  1. Select a time for the reminder.
The time drop down menu highlighted with a red square
  1. Click on the Save button
The save button highlighted with a red square

Success

if all steps have been followed correctly, then your message should be highlighted with blue with text indicating your set time for your reminder Example of a successful reminder being set

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have completed and learnt how to:

  • Mark a message as unread.
  • Set a reminder for a message.

Congratulations! 🎉 You can now read a message and maintain the unread mark and notification. Click the link below to learn how to troubleshoot issues you may face in completing this task or any of the others:

Troubleshooting

docs.title: How to Send A File Through a DM
docs.text:
As a student, when working on a group project, you may be required to share files with each other. Although this seems trivial and can be done in many ways, Slack provides a streamlined process in which this can be done so that your file sharing and communication can happen all in one place.

In this section you will create a new DM and send a file to one of your colleagues.

docs.title: Steps to Sending a File Through a DM
docs.text:
1. Click on the DMs button on the left side navigation bar.
The DMs button highlighted with a red square in the left naviagiton bar
  1. Click on the New Message icon.
The New Message icon highlighted with a red square

Success

If steps have been followed correctly, then a new message panel will be opened

  1. Add recipient to the textbox labelled "To:" to the "New Message" panel.
The "To:" textbox highlighted with a red square

Note

you can also click a user under the tab labelled "Direct Messages" under the leftside channel listings. Users can be differentiated from channels by their respective profile pictures

  1. Click on Attach icon labelled "+"
The Attach icon highlighted with a red square
  1. Click on Upload from your computer
The Upload from your computer button highlighted with a red square

Note

You can also use the keyboard shortcut ctrl + U

Success

if steps have been followed correctly, then a file explorer popup will have appeared

  1. Select the file you would like to send.

  2. Click open in the file explorer.

  3. (optional) Add message to New Message text box.

Example of a message being included in the textbox
  1. Click on the green Send now button.
The Send now button highlighted with a red square

Note

you can use the keyboard shortcut enter

Success

if all steps have been followed correctly, then you will see your message and your embedded file in the Direct Message panel Your message and your embedded file in the **Direct Message** panel

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have completed and learnt how to:

  • Access the direct messages panel.
  • Start a direct message with a specifec user.
  • Send a file, with the option to include a message, through a DM.

Congratulations! 🎉 You can now send your colleagues files in the same place you communicate with them. Click the link below to learn how to mark messages as unread and set a reminder for them:

Mark a Message Unread and set a Reminder

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Term Definition Workspace A centralized hub where workspace members can communicate through organized and labeled text channels. Direct Message A private environment where two or more users can communicate. Similar to a text message or a group text chat. Channel A public environment where people within the workspace can communicate.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Problem Cause Solution Unable to record the pronunciation of your name Your browser does not have access to your microphone. Give your browser access to your microphone through the "site permissions page" of your web browser. The recording of your name pronunciation is silent Your microphone was muted during recording or your playback device is muted. Ensure that your microphone is not muted and your playback device is able to play sound. Unable to attach file to your message The file type you are attempting to send is unsupported by slack. Convert your file to a .zip version and use it instead of the unsupported file type. Slack supports sending and recieving .zip files.
